In 1986, Q13 Fox became one of the first affiliates of the Fox Broadcasting Company. As the Fox network’s viewership and ratings grew in the 1990s, it gained prominence as a broadcaster in the local Seattle market. Q13 Fox also launched a morning newscast on January 17, 2000, which eventually expanded to its current 5-1/2 hour telecast. On March 31, 2008, the station launched a 9 p.m. newscast on KZJO, formerly KMYQ. In June 2011, it added a 5 p.m. newscast. Washington’s Most Wanted, hosted by anchor David Rose, also airs on KCPQ and KZJO. The Tribune Company acquired Q13 Fox in August 1998. It is sister to MyNetworkTV affiliate KZJO. Q13 Fox is operated from Seattle, Washington.

Full Description: The "Helping Fight the Maternal Mortality Rate" Foundation is a beacon of hope and a catalyst for change in the realm of maternal healthcare. Our mission is to address one of the most pressing global health issues of our time: the alarmingly high maternal mortality rate. Every year, thousands of women, particularly women of color, face life-threatening challenges during pregnancy and childbirth. Our foundation was born out of a deep sense of urgency to make a difference. We believe that every mother deserves the opportunity to bring new life into this world safely and with the support she needs. Our commitment is unwavering, fueled by the personal experience of our founder, Shan, who faced a traumatic birthing experience that resulted in the loss of her child and nearly cost her life. Shan's journey became the driving force behind our foundation's mission, inspiring us to train doulas, advocates, and support networks that empower women through every stage of their maternal journey. At "Helping Fight the Maternal Mortality Rate," we are not just a foundation; we are a movement. We are dedicated to training doulas who will stand by women during childbirth, advocating for their rights, and providing the care and support that every mother deserves. Our work extends beyond childbirth, encompassing postpartum care, lactation support, nutrition guidance, and financial assistance for mothers in need. Together with our global community of supporters, partners, and compassionate individuals like you, we are working tirelessly to reduce maternal mortality rates, foster empowerment, and bring about lasting change in maternal healthcare. Join us in our mission to make childbirth a safe and joyful experience for every woman, everywhere. With your help, we can transform the maternal healthcare landscape, one mother at a time, and help bring an end to the heartbreaking toll of maternal mortality.
